data.title: Index < Kimmis: Essex Dedications
data.text:
{9–17, amended}

INDEX

The following list of Essex parish churches has been compiled from various sources, particularly the RCHM report. The churches are grouped according to dedication, in order of popularity. Within each group, parishes are listed alphabetically, save that churches with joint or multiple dedications are listed separately. Modern churches, built to serve urban expansion, are not listed. The six-figure grid references will serve to locate the churches using the Ordnance Survey 1:50,000 (Landranger) maps.

(x) indicates that a church is no longer used; some have been demolished, some are ruinous and others have been converted for community use or as private dwellings.

(*) indicates that the dedication of a church has been changed.

(?) indicates that the dedication is not certain.

NOTE: This index is intended as a permanent work of reference and will be reviewed next year for a possible second edition. The compiler would therefore be glad to know of any corrections or additions that would make it more useful.

ESSEX CHURCH DEDICATIONS : An index with notes on distribution and on the calendar of saints’ days

Compiled by Jim Kimmis and published by Essex Landscape Mysteries.

First edition 1981. There is no copyright on this publication, but an acknowledgement would be appreciated where the contents are used.

Essex Landscape Mysteries is a non-profit-making venture. This paper is the first in an occasional series to be published by ELM. There is also a quarterly magazine dealing with the county’s antiquities, folklore and paraphenomena. For further details of the magazine and other publications, please write to:

32 Onslow Crescent,
